subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Scaling Teams Without Losing Speed
description: A quick, practical guide to Scaling Teams Without Losing Speed.

hook.text: A 5-person team ships weekly. They grow to 50 people and suddenly nothing ships for months.

buildup.text: Brooks's Law: adding people to a late project makes it later. Communication overhead grows exponentially.

discovery.text: Amazon solved this with the two-pizza rule. If a team can't be fed by two pizzas, it's too big.

twist.text: The fix isn't fewer peopleâ€”it's smaller, autonomous teams with clear ownership and minimal dependencies.

climax.text: Spotify's squad model gave small teams full autonomy. They scaled to 4,000 engineers without gridlock.

punchline.text: Scale the org by shrinking the teams.

quiz.question: What is Amazon's two-pizza rule about?
options: Keeping teams small enough to be fed by two pizzas
Spending no more than two pizzas' worth on team meals
Holding meetings only when two teams need to coordinate
